content: The "Independent Medical Review Act of 1999" may be cited as the short title. Special rules apply to group health plans. Section 503 of ERISA is amended to include special rules for group health plans, such as notification of appeal rights to utilization review agents and independent review organizations. The amendment to Section 503 of ERISA includes rules for group health plans regarding the notification of appeal rights to utilization review agents and independent review organizations. Participants or beneficiaries have the right to appeal adverse determinations to an independent review organization, including immediate review for life-threatening conditions, and fair, de novo determinations of medical necessity. The amendment to Section 503 of ERISA allows participants or beneficiaries to appeal adverse determinations to a utilization review agent. The procedures for appeals must be reasonable and include the option to appeal orally or in writing. The agent must acknowledge receipt of the appeal within 5 working days and provide a list of required documents. The utilization review agent must acknowledge receipt of an appeal within 5 working days and provide a list of required documents. Oral appeals will receive a one-page appeal form. Appeal decisions will be made by a physician, with the option for a specialty provider review if good cause is provided within 10 working days. The denial shall be reviewed by a health care provider in the same specialty within 15 working days. An expedited appeal procedure for emergency care denials must be completed within one working day. The appeal process for medical or dental conditions must be completed within one working day. The utilization review agent must issue a response letter explaining the resolution of the appeal, including specific reasons and clinical basis. Written notification of the appeal determination must be provided within 30 days. The appeal process for medical or dental conditions must be completed within one working day. Written notification of the appeal determination must be provided within 30 days. If an appeal is denied, a participant can seek review from an independent organization ensuring timely response and confidentiality of medical records. The appeal process for medical or dental conditions must be completed within one working day, with written notification of the determination provided within 30 days. An independent review organization ensures timely response, confidentiality of medical records, independence of healthcare providers, and timely notice of results to the participant or beneficiary. The utilization review agent must provide relevant medical records, documents used in making the determination, written notification of the clinical basis for denial, and any submitted documentation to the independent review organization within 3 business days of receiving a request for review of an adverse determination. The independent review organization must make a determination within 15 days of receiving necessary information, including medical records, documents, and a list of relevant healthcare providers. The organization must make a determination within a specified timeframe after receiving necessary information or a request. In the case of a life-threatening condition, the determination must be made even sooner. The independent review organization must make a determination within a set timeframe upon receiving necessary information or a request. Certification by the Secretary is required for an organization to be considered independent. To be certified as an independent review organization, an applicant must submit annual information to the Secretary, including details on stockholders, affiliated organizations, bond holders, and key personnel. The applicant for certification as an independent review organization must provide details on bond holders exceeding $100,000, biographical sketches of key personnel, and any relationships with entities in the healthcare industry. The applicant for certification as an independent review organization must provide details on revenue sources, expertise of review professionals, and review procedures. The independent review determination made by the organization is binding on the plan. The independent review organization's determination is final and binding on the plan, and may only be vacated or modified by a court under specific circumstances. The organization must be independent and cannot be affiliated with a payor or their association. The independent review organization must be independent and not affiliated with a payor or their association. An adverse determination is a decision by a group health plan that certain health care services are not medically necessary. A health care provider is an individual licensed to deliver health care services in a State.
